posts.post_content:
wow that is depressing I got first comment and it was deleted along with every other comment I did for Eldrazi cards. But the important thing is has anyone noticed its name can be shortened to EAT? cause it eats games I guess  
  
@tabqwerty  
  
You know that protection from colored spells, doesn't actually do anything when its a creature card in a deck? You also know that [Polymorph](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Polymorph) doesn't:  
  
**D**eal damage to EAT  
**E**nchant EAT  
**B**lock EAT  
**T**arget EAT  
  
It doesn't do any of that when it flips cards and puts Emrakul into play, you can't cast [Polymorph](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Polymorph) on Emrakul, but the effect can put him into play.  
  
Lastly, you know a bunch of people play a deck like this right? I dunno how many people could get break the rules...

posts.post_content:
The way the Eldrazi block was done flavor-wise was exceptionally clever: multiple cards printed in the earlier two sets have potent effects that are rendered powerless against the Eldrazi. Examples:  
  
1) [Iona, Shield of Emeria](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Iona, Shield of Emeria) lets you bar a colour. That's just dandy.  
2) [Terra Eternal](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Terra Eternal) won't save your lands from being sacrificed  
3) [Agadeem Occultist](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Agadeem Occultist) is a minor example, but the CMC of most Eldrazi is prohibitively high.  
4) [Anowon, the Ruin Sage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Anowon, the Ruin Sage) will be making a full-on Eldrazi deck sacrifice an Eldrazi Spawn token every turn rather than doing anything useful.  
5) [Brave the Elements](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Brave the Elements), although that was probably unintentional since it's a pretty standard utility.  
6) [Deathless Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Deathless Angel)'s indestructibility fails to protect creatures from annihilator. (This is a common theme among the set's angels, the reason being that most of them were supporters of the "gods" which turned... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:

1) Iona, Shield of Emeria lets you bar a colour. That's just dandy.
2) Terra Eternal won't save your lands from being sacrificed
3) Agadeem Occultist is a minor example, but the CMC of most Eldrazi is prohibitively high.
4) Anowon, the Ruin Sage will be making a full-on Eldrazi deck sacrifice an Eldrazi Spawn token every turn rather than doing anything useful.
5) Brave the Elements, although that was probably unintentional since it's a pretty standard utility.
6) Deathless Angel's indestructibility fails to protect creatures from annihilator. (This is a common theme among the set's angels, the reason being that most of them were supporters of the "gods" which turned... (see all)

posts.post_content:
"Mrs. the Aeons Torn?"
  
   
"Yes, officers, how may I help you?"
  
   
"We are extremely sorry you had to hear it like this, but your husband, Emerakul, was killed in a barfight."
  
   
"Oh!... Oh my god!... (wipes eye with tentacle). How did this happen?"
  
   
"It appears he provoked another patron of the bar, one Mossbridge Troll, and was killed due to blunt-force trauma on the, um, head... body... thing."
  
   
"But... I don't understand. Emerakul always had the highest power and toughness of anybody in town!"
  
   
"Yes, but see here? The second part of Mr. Troll's card text? It clearly shows that he was on drugs at the time, and was obviously the only one capable of murdering your husband."
  
   
"What? What the hell?! How could that happen? You mean to tell me some stupid troll just got up and beat my husband, a thousand ton, gravity defying, five hundred foot tall eldrazi god with the ability to cause the death of any six cards in the game in an eyeblink, to death with his fists? What, am I on Ca... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content:
Emrakul has protection from colored **spells**, not colors, so there are any number of ways to neutralize this, or steal it from your opponent, or kill it.  
  
[Seasinger](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Seasinger), [Captivating Vampire](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Captivating Vampire), [Cytoplast Manipulator](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cytoplast Manipulator), [Empress Galina](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Empress Galina), [Helm of Possession](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Helm of Possession), [Infernal Denizen](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Infernal Denizen), [Keiga, the Tide Star](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Keiga, the Tide Star), [Memnarch](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Memnarch), [Nicol Bolas, Planeswalker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nicol Bolas, Planeswalker), [Rubinia Soulsinger](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rubinia Soulsinger) or her cousin [Merieke Ri Berit](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Merieke Ri Berit), [Willow Satyr](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Willow Satyr), [Crown of Empires](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Crown of Empires), [Trip Noose](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Trip Noose), [Icy Manipulator](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Icy Manipulator), [Royal Assassin](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Royal Assassin), [Amber Prison](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Amber Prison), [Tsabo Tavoc](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tsabo Tavoc), [Aphetto Grifter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Aphetto Grifter), [Attrition](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Attrition), [Diversionary Tactics](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Diversionary Tactics), [Elder Druid/aut](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Elder Druid/aut)... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: dark_hero (1/17/2011 11:07:55 PM)
Rating:

Turn 1
- Swamp -> -> Dark Ritual -> ;
- with Entomb Emrakul; Emrakul's triggered ability which forces you to shuffle your graveyard into your library triggers and goes on the stack;
- with cast Shallow Grave; It goes on top of the stack, above the triggered ability;
- Shallow Grave resolves, and Emrakul enters the battlefield with haste;
- Emrakul's triggered ability resolves, and you shuffle your (empty) graveyard into your library;
- ATTACK!!!

Posted By: MMT (11/7/2012 2:00:55 AM)
Rating:

Door to nothingness costs to one shot someone. This can do it for and cant be countered. Why does door come into play tapped again?

@SteamyRayvon
Notice the keyword "Cast". You actually have to pay its mana cost, normally from your hand as well, to cast this card. You can very well cheat this into play with Quicksilver Amulet or Elvish Piper, but you don't get an extra turn from it.

@Greenman
Oblivion Ring, and Journey to Nowhere still very much work against Emrakul. When they hit the battlefield they are not spells, they are permanents with triggered abilities going on the stack. Emrakul does not have protection from abilities. I bring this up because I couldn't tell you how many polymorph decks I played in zendikar standard that got hosed by my oblivion ring. Hes not as sturdy as he looks!

posts.post_content: What people don't seem to realize is that he has "Protection from all colour spells", meaning you basically can't target him with ANYTHING that would exile, sacrifice, destroy, the works. Unless you of course used an artifact.

@knight3607

As Phyrexian Ingester enters the battlefield, it is a permanent and no longer a spell. Emrakul will not have protection from it.

@SteamyRayvon6969: You don't get the extra turn with a quicksilver amulet (or with show and tell, elvish piper, aether vial etc). It specifically says when you CAST it. You CAST it with either of the following:
* 15 mana
* Omniscience
